context: The word 'proovida' is an Estonian verb that means 'to try' or 'to attempt'. It is the infinitive form of the verb. When conjugated, it takes different forms depending on the subject: 'proovin' (I try), 'proovib' (he/she/it tries), 'proovime' (we try). This verb is commonly used when expressing an effort to do something or testing something out.
